key_channel_insights.line_content: OTAs list higher fares than VN.com in 92% of observations, with disparity heaviest on short-haul Vietnam-origin markets.
Meta-search shows a 51% ‘higher’ rate but 15% meaningful undercuts (-6-7%), especially on long-haul and non-Vietnam origins, signalling leakage risk.
93% of VN website fares are absent from GDS; parity is inching up (5.9%) but visibility remains critically low for corporate buyers.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: OTAs priced above VN.com in 92% of cases last week; undercuts remain negligible (0.05%).
‘OTA Higher’ share fell 0.7 ppts WoW and 1.8 ppts MoM, hinting first traction from recent parity actions.
94% of short-haul routes carry an OTA premium versus 23% on long-haul, pinpointing where corrective action yields greatest impact.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: VN offer missing only 2.9% of the time—operationally acceptable.
Exact fare match sits at 5.4%, well below the 20% internal benchmark despite a 2 ppt MoM rise.
91.6% of itineraries show OTA premiums; metric is easing but remains the norm.
OTA lower pricing appears in just 0.05% of checks—statistically negligible.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: 75% parity, 23% premiums, and 1.8% undercuts suggest rising competition abroad.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Premium rate lower at 33%, but rose 18 ppts WoW as parity eroded.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: OTA premiums in 91% of checks; chief leakage area despite 1.3 ppt WoW drop.
Premium incidence 92% and rising (+0.8 ppt), signalling early-booking margin dilution.

mse_highlights.line_content: MSE fares above VN.com in 51% of cases, down 11 ppts WoW.
When lower (15% incidence), discounts average 6-7%, posing real defection risk.
Long-haul & non-VN origins see MSE undercutting 82-91% of the time.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Only 2% of queries lack a VN fare.
Parity share reached 32% (+9 ppts WoW), reflecting better alignment.
‘Higher’ share at 51% (-11 ppts WoW) with modest 3% premium.
‘Lower’ share up to 15%; average discount widened to ‑6%.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 82% MSE undercuts at 6% discount on premium routes.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: MSE higher in 53% of checks; parity up 10 ppts WoW.
91% undercuts despite small sample—urgent pricing review required.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Higher 47%, lower 16%; discounts deeper (-7%) as ‘higher’ share falls 13 ppts.
Higher 60% with modest 3-4% premium; 12% undercuts at ‑5%.

gds_highlights.line_content: Website fares largely missing from GDS, limiting corporate reach.
Matched fares inch up (+0.4 ppt WoW) but still insufficient.
Only 1.1% higher-priced, 0.05% lower-priced; issue is content, not pricing.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Content absent in nine of ten itineraries; flat WoW.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Only 12.3% N/A, but 10.5% price higher—double the average.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 96.2% fares missing; almost no price variances.
N/A drops to 8.9%, yet 30.4% higher-priced, hurting competitiveness.
